revised_title: Indian Manuscripts and Books from Fort St. George
tldr: The author, George Lewis, shares information about Indian manuscripts and books he has collected at Fort St. George. He describes various languages and characters used in the manuscripts and mentions the arrival of Chinese books in three volumes. He also mentions a translation of the Gentio Laws and other religious texts, as well as a book on the Tulinga alphabet. The letter is addressed to Dr. Arthur Charlett and Dr. Edward Bernard, and the manuscripts are later presented to the University of Oxford.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Oriental Studies
